Class Sudoku

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sudoku
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Sudoku
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains all the information pertaining to one Sudoku puzzle.
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • initSudoku

        public void initSudoku(int[] coordinates,
              int difficulty)
        Loads up the unsolved Sudoku and solves it
        Parameters:
        coordinates - The array of individual numbers in the Sudoku
        difficulty - The selected difficulty by the player

      • cloneUnsolvedSudoku

        private int[][] cloneUnsolvedSudoku()

      • initConditionMatrices

        public void initConditionMatrices()
        Initialises the Condition Matrices which are responsible for whether a given value exists in a row, column or sub-grid.

      • setSolutionValueConditions

        private void setSolutionValueConditions(int i,
                              int j,
                              int value,
                              boolean exists)
        If a new number is added to the Sudoku by the player, this method records its existence in the related conditional matrices.
        Parameters:
        i - The row of the value.
        j - The column of the value.
        value - The value that is being added.
        exists - A boolean that says whether the exists in the corresponding rows, columns or sub-grids.

      • solve

        public boolean solve()
        Method that calls the algorithm to be solved from the start
        Returns:
        Returns true or false for whether the Sudoku can be solved or not

      • solve

        private boolean solve(int i,
            int j)
        The backtracking algorithm that is responsible for solving the Sudoku.
        Parameters:
        i - The current row.
        j - The current column.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the algorithm can solve the Sudoku and false if it can't.

      • isValid

        private boolean isValid(int i,
              int j,
              int value)
        Checks whether a given value already exists in the row, column and sub-grid.
        Parameters:
        i - The row.
        j - The column.
        value - The value to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the value can go in the specified row, column and sub-grid; false otherwise.

      • findBoxNum

        private int findBoxNum(int i,
             int j)
        Calculates which sub-grid a given coordinate is in.
        Parameters:
        i - The row.
        j - The column.
        Returns:
        Returns the sub-grid number.

      • resetSudoku

        public void resetSudoku()
        Resets the user's sudoku with the original unsolved sudoku.
